result.execSummary:
The defendant Shanda Jo Wilk was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess/Illegally Obtained Prescription [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "A"], an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 450.11(7)(h).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor [Modifiers: Penalty-Fraud/Obtaining Prescriptions], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
***AMENDED***
Per Judge Howard W. Cameron January 8, 2015 - Court notes 1 day credit if revoked.

Court reads-in and dismisses Count 2.
Defendant to report to Probation today November 24, 2014 by 12:00 p.m.
Attorneys to send letter to the Court with jail credit.

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

miscConds.notes:
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #14CF286.
Court waives all Court costs other than DNA surcharge.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

Case called at 3:05 p.m. ADA Collins states this should be set for a review hearing today and requesting a continuation of DJOC. Extend conditional jail time for 60 days so defendant may finish AODA program in the jail and then go to treatment. Not proposing to revoke DPA or probation at this time. Sentencing order of the court will be modified with 60 day condition time.  Atty Smestad put time  on Ct 3. Misd. Bail Jumping on 14CF286. Court reviewed the file and is satisfied with the proposed modifications. Satisfied that victims rights notifications have been provided. Court will order:

- Impose additional 60 day condition time on Ct.3 in case 14CF286

- Defendant may be released to the Butterfly House for treatment at the discretion of the supervising probation agent

CO: Cameron, RPR: Drost, Clerk: Webb,ADA:  Kevin H. Gehler   DF ATTY:  T Gregory Amann   DF:  Shanda Jo Wilk appeared.  Court called at 4:47 p.m.  Includes case 14CF243, 14CF286, 14CF301, 14CF488, 14CF501 & 14CM305.  ADA Gehler advises the court the State is recommending a 36 month Diversion Agreement.  DE files a Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights Form with the court.  DE pleads Guilty to Ct 1 in 14CF243 and Ct. 1 and Ct. 3 in 14CF286.  Crt informs DE of rights. Attorneys stipulate to the facts.  Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly makes plea. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 in 14CF243 but withholds sentence due to deferred judgment and Ct. 1 and Ct. 3 in 14CF286. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses  but reads in for purposes of restitution Ct 2 in 14CF243 and Ct. 2. in 14CF286 and all counts in 14CF301, 14CF488, 14CF501 & 14CM305.  Court signs the Diversion Agreement.  Court adjourned at 5:17 p.m.  lw

S/W 2 years probation with conditions on Ct. 1 and Ct. 3 on 14CF286
- AODA with follow through
- Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
- Report to probation by 12:00 p.m. on 11/24/14
- Court waives all court costs and DE to pay $200.00 for DNA surcharges on Ct 1 and Ct. 3 on 14CF286
- Attorneys send letter to court with jail credit.
- 20 days to appeal

Attorney Amann advises the court they are working towards a resolution.  Set 14CF243 for trial.   Bond continues in form and amount.  Court adjourned at  1:17 p.m. lw  Jury trial scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
